intro: Senecio subglomerosus, commonly known as the clustered groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a rough texture, and the flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense groups. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
